etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Thomas Herbert. From Panjabi pagṛī turban, head, mark of distinction, of unknown origin

definitions: In South Asia, especially in the northern region: a turban or head covering.
A scarf, usually of thin muslin, wound round the crown of a sun helmet or hat and originally fastened so that the ends hung down at the back to shade the neck.

notes.text: Worn especially by members of the British Army serving abroad.
